page.title: 07THE MILL & CLIMBING BOTHY.
page.content: Close to the Clova Hotel there is a very old stone building.It was originally a water mill but through the years it has been put to various uses _ for milling grain, generating electricty and as a fish hatchery. Today it is used as a climbers' bothy. It can and does accomodate up to 30 persons especially at weekends. The building is single storied and contains only one room. It is bereft of furniture but it does contain a solid fuel stove. The cost of the overnight accomodation is Â£1.35 and a bath may be taken at the hotel for 50p. During 1984 the mill wheel has been repaired and made operational. It is an overshot wheel. A mill pond is currently in the process of being constructed.
